page.title: 10GLOSSOPDALE RELIGION
page.content: Since 1970 there has been a definite move towards{unity}amongst the different{Christian}groups. There is a greater{sharing of ideas}and a lot more{willingness to help}each other. People no-longer ask about the denomination to which they belong but 'Are you a fellow Christian?' People are tired of disunity and long for{ {togetherness.}The Vicar of St. Luke's told us of a joint visit to Sheffield to hear{Dr. Billy Graham.}When asked how far young people are involved in the church he said, 'I would like to see them more involved in the community as they are not really taking part.' Altogether there are 22 churches in our area belonging to the CofE,RC,Methodist,Baptist,Pentecostal, and Spiritualist churches. Although there are a few followers of{other {faiths}they have no meeting places.
